basic.floral_language:
Syringa vulgaris
Floriography: pure, noble, persistent.
Syringa vulgaris is a deciduous shrub or small tree. It is the official flower of Haerbing city. The plant usually grows to a big size. Its small but fine flower, with four to five petals, possesses elegant color and unique diffused scent. It is widely cultured in yards, gardens, roadside for the scent.
Syringa vulgaris enjoys sunny days, slightly shade tolerant. Best to grow in a place with plenty of sunlight. Bloom in March to June, lasts for three to four weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period March-June, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, slight shade tolerance, grows in sunny places
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Fertilization not much required, dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply fertilizers once in each month in spring before flower budding and before overwintering
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
